business.headline: Vedanta shares cross Rs 500 mark after gaining 5%. More gains ahead?Vedanta's performance in 2024 has been impressive, with the stock climbing 95% so far this year and gaining 124.35% over the last 12 months. Over a five-year period, the stock has risen by 202%.
Sensex, Nifty close at all-time high led by rally in auto and metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 666.25 points to end at 85,836.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 211.90 points to close at 26,216.05.
Tata Steel shares gain for 5th straight session. What should investors do?In the past year, Tata Steel has rallied 28%, with an 18% gain so far in 2024.

Trent shares surge to record high on Citi's 'buy' call. Check detailsCiti set a target price of Rs 9,250 for the stock, signaling a 21% upside from the previous closing price, and added it to its Pan-Asia high-conviction focus list.

Puneet Chhatwal eyes top 3 spot for Taj Hotels in global hospitalityHe envisions the brand securing its place among the top three global hospitality companies in the next five years, a goal driven by Taj's ethos of service, adaptability to changing luxury trends, and a commitment to sustainable growth.

80% of your portfolio should be 'Dal-Chawal': Radhika Gupta's investment mantraRadhika Gupta's message focused on the importance of disciplined, long-term investing—what she calls "Dal-Chawal Investing"—a simple and sustainable approach she believes will help investors navigate the market's highs and lows.

Diffusion Engineers IPO opens for subscription: Should you subcribe?The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 159 and Rs 168 per share. Investors can apply for a minimum lot of 88 shares, requiring a retail investment of Rs 14,784.
Manba Finance IPO allotment: Check status, expected listing gain, subscriptionManba Finance IPO opened for subscription on September 23 and ran until September 25, generating huge bids.

Hyundai Motors IPO: Can it beat Maruti Suzuki's market valuation?Hyundai, the second-largest automaker in India, has maintained a steady market share of 15-17% since 2008. But does it have what it takes to beat market leader Maruti Suzuki's valuation?

Gold, silver price today, September 26, 2024: Yellow metal records dip, silver trades higher on MCXGold Price Today 26 September 2024: Gold is trading on the lower side while silver rates have recorded a hike on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Thursday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high as rally extends for 5th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex rose to an all-time high of 85,333.23 in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed to 26,056.

Hyundai to Swiggy: 5 big IPOs set to light up Dalal Street before 2024 endsFrom Hyundai Motors' massive offering to Swiggy's much-anticipated debut, the year's final IPOs could be the most exciting ones yet.

Sensex, Nifty hit record high as power and financial stock drive market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 255.83 points to end at 85,169.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.75 points to close at 26,004.15.

PNB, SBI, UCO: JM Financial lists 11 PSU bank stocks worth buying after selloffSince reaching its 52-week high, the PSU Bank index has dropped by 15%, with banks like UCO Bank, Bank of India (BOI), Indian Overseas Bank (IOB), and Union Bank of India seeing sharper declines of 25-30%.

Easy Trip Planners shares plunge 20% to record low. Here's what happenedThe steep decline in share price was triggered by news that promoter Nishant Pitti plans to sell 15 crore shares, representing 8.5% of the company's total share capital, in a block deal.

Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat see lowest youth unemployment, Kerala strugglesMadhya Pradesh and Gujarat have emerged as the best performers, boasting the lowest youth unemployment rates, while Kerala struggles with one of the highest.

Coldplay mania: Mumbai hotel rates up by 300% for concert weekendWith Coldplay set to perform at DY Patil Stadium on January 18-19 and 21, 2025, hotel prices in Mumbai have skyrocketed, which might leave fans scrambling for accommodation.

Explained: Why Reliance Power shares hit 5% upper circuit today Reliance Power stock: What's behind the fresh rally? Investors are buzzing as the company makes big moves—find out what's driving the surge.

Salaried employees work longer hours than casual workers, finds surveyFor many corporate workers, these 48-hour weeks translate to roughly 9 hours of work each day if they're working five days a week, or 8 hours if it's a six-day work week.
Hyundai IPO gets Sebi clearence. Check expected listing date The company submitted its draft papers in June 2024 and the IPO may be launched as soon as October.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Karnataka withdraws general consent to CBI as BJP demands probe in MUDA caseIn an apparent move to prevent potential CBI interference against Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, the Karnataka Cabinet decided to withdraw permission for the central agency to conduct investigations in the state.

Will police clap if shot at? Devendra Fadnavis on Badlapur encounterSpeaking on the shooting of the Badlapur sexual assault accused, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said glorification of such incidents should not happen.

Netanyahu orders troops to continue Lebanon op, his partners reject ceasefire callThe heaviest fighting in nearly two decades between Israel and the Iran-backed Hezbollah group has raised fears of a new Israeli ground offensive across the Lebanese-Israeli frontier.

No Durga Puja holidays, no idol immersion, Islamists in Bangladesh warn HindusAn organisation called Insaf Keemkari Chhatra-Janta staged a protest in Dhaka, holding placards in Bangla that read: "no worship everywhere by closing roads, no pollution to water by idol immersion, no worship to idol".
Pigeon menace: A health hazard thriving in plain sightFeeding pigeons, a common practice in India, can lead to severe lung diseases due to exposure to their droppings.

What are 3 achievements, weaknesses of Modi government: What Chidambaram saidP Chidambaram credited the NDA government for carrying forward improvement of the network of national highways that was started by Atal Bihari Vajpayee's Golden Quadrilateral project.

'Why with BCCI only?' Supreme Court questions order clearing Byju's settlementA three-judge bench headed by Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud also asked the interim resolution professional (IRP) to maintain status quo and not hold any committee of creditor's meeting until the Supreme Court delivers its final judgement on the matter.

I won't resign: Siddaramaiah on Karnataka Lokayukta FIR in Muda 'scam'Siddaramaiah's assertion came a day after a special Karnataka court ordered the Lokayukta to conduct a probe against him over alleged irregularities in the Muda case, paving the way to register an FIR against the Chief Minister.

Navya Naveli Nanda opens up about handling social media trolls after IIM admissionNavya Naveli Nanda discusses handling social media trolls after her IIM Ahmedabad admission, emphasising the importance of constructive feedback.

With KL Rahul at No. 6, India looking at bigger picture in Tests: Hanuma VihariHanuma Vihari believes KL Rahul's spot at No. 6 is part of a larger strategy for India's tour of Australia, citing Rahul's strong performances in SENA countries (South Africa, England, New Zealand, and Australia). Despite an underwhelming return to Test cricket after seven months, the team management values his experience in challenging conditions.

Congress raps Vikramaditya Singh over Himachal's eateries' order: SourcesThe Congress came under fire over the diktat as the party had criticised a similar move by the Uttar Pradesh government during the Kanwar Yatra a few weeks back.

Beerbiceps aka Ranveer Allahbadia says his channels hacked: End of my YouTube career?Most of Ranveer Allahbadia's content, including interviews and podcasts, were deleted from his YouTube channels. The videos, instead, were replaced with old streams of events featuring Elon Musk and Donald Trump.
US woman reveals 3 reasons why she shifted to India in new videoKristen Fischer, a US woman who shifted to Delhi two years ago, has revealed three reasons why she chose India as her new home.
IPL 2025: Rishabh Pant slams fan for 'fake news' over potential move to RCBRishabh Pant slammed X user for spreading fake news about him approaching to join RCB for IPL 2025.

Navya Nanda on Kolkata rape-murder case: Women deserve better, she deserved better Entrepreneur Navya Naveli Nanda attended India Today Conclave Mumbai on Thursday, September 26, where she spoke about the horrific Kolkata rape and murder incident.

France's Macron backs India's bid for permanent seat in UN Security CouncilAlong with supporting India's push to be a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council, Emmanuel Macron batted for representation from Africa.

Inside Doctor Death's 'suicide pod' that has sparked an ethics debateThe futuristic-looking capsule has sparked a global debate on ethics after an American woman became the first person to use the pod to end her life.
Star Health Insurance sues Telegram over data leak by hacker using chatbotsThe lawsuit comes amid growing scrutiny of Telegram globally and the arrest of its founder Pavel Durov in France last month.

Suspect argued with victim before killing her, says suicide noteThe suspect's body was found in Odisha's Bhadrak district. According to the police, he was found hanging, and a case of suicide has been filed at the Dushuri Police Station.

Why it's lonely at the top for Hezbollah chief NasrallahIn the past week, Hezbollah has lost many of its top leaders to Israeli offensive. Despite the Iranian support and counsel, Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah might be lonely. Does this provide a golden opportunity for Israel?

Actor Divya Dutta shares 'horrendous experience' with IndiGo after flight cancellationActor Divya Dutta slammed IndiGo for cancelling her flight without prior notification. The actor shared her distressing experience on social media and vented out her frustration in a lengthy note.

Delay over holding fresh India-China high-level military talks to resolve border rowFollowing the 21st round of India-China Corps Commander-level talks on February 19, no subsequent high-level military meetings to resolve the border dispute have occurred, marking a seven-month hiatus.

Government extends AFSPA in parts of Nagaland, Arunachal for 6 monthsAFSPA has been extended in parts of Nagaland and Arunachal Pradesh for six more months after a review of the law and order situation in the two northeastern states.

BJP leader condemns revealing clothes of woman in Indore: Will not be toleratedMadhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister Kailash Vijayvargiya's comments drew sharp criticism from the Opposition, with Congress questioning, "Who are you to dictate what a woman should wear?"

Patralekhaa's first impression of husband Rajkummar Rao: He's very creepyActor Patralekhaa recently opened up about her first impression of her husband and actor Rajkummar Rao. The actor said that she initially found Rajkummar "creepy."

Navya Naveli at India Today Conclave 2024: Never wanted to act but respect legacyNavya Naveli attended Day 2 of the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2024 on Thursday, September 26, where she spoke about the legacy of her family and how she is making different choices for her career and business.

SL vs NZ: Dinesh Chandimal continues love affair with Galle with 6th Test hundredStar Sri Lanka batter Dinesh Chandimal brought up his maiden Test hundred against New Zealand on Day 1 of the second Test at Galle.

India will select playing XI for Kanpur Test based on conditions: Abhishek NayarIND vs BAN: Batting coach Abhishek Nayar said that India will select their playing XI for the second Test against Bangladesh in Kanpur only after looking at the pitch and playing conditions.

Rishabh Pant bowls spin to Shubman Gill in Kanpur: Tagdi practice karwayiRishabh Pant rolled his arm over to bowl spin at Shubman Gill in a video posted by the BCCI. Gill also admitted that Rishabh Pant gave him good practice during the training session in Kanpur.

Hopeful Rahul's Test career will have a turnaround: Assistant coach NayarIndia assistant coach Abhishek Nayar backed senior batter KL Rahul to regain his form during the Kanpur Test against Bangladesh. Rahul aims to return to form in the Kanpur Test against Bangladesh after a lackluster performance in Chennai.

Why doesn't Indian Test team have a vice-captain? Coach Abhishek Nayar explainsIndia vs Bangladesh: Speaking to the press on the eve of the second Test in Kanpur, assistant coach Abhishek Nayar explained why India did not have a designated vice-captain for the two-match series against Bangladesh. Nayar lauded the maturity shown by youngsters in the team.

Will Kanpur's hometown boy Kuldeep Yadav feature in India's XI? Nayar revealsAbhishek Nayar revealed if Kuldeep Yadav would feature in India's playing XI at the Green Park Stadium in Kanpur, which is his home ground. Kuleep didn't feature in the team in the 1st Test as India went with three pacers.

Shakib Al Hasan announces Test retirement, wishes to play final match at homeBangladesh's ace all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan revealed that the upcoming Test series against South Africa at home will be his last in the format.

Wish Pant was Australian: Mitchell Marsh lauds India star's sensational comebackAustralia captain Mitchell Marsh has commended Indian cricketer Rishabh Pant for his incredible recovery and return to the sport after a serious car accident. Marsh said he wished Rishabh Pant was Australian.

Never be satisfied with your achievements, PM Modi tells Chess Olympiad championsChess Olympiad 2024: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted India's chess champions at his residence on Wednesday, September 25. From discussing the importance of decision-making to listening keenly to the role of Artificial Intelligence in the sport, PM Modi enjoyed his interaction with the star players.

Women's T20 World Cup: Lisa Sthalekar backs India to at least reach semi-finalsLisa Sthalekar ranked India as one of the favourites to at least reach the semi-final of the Women's T20 World Cup, if not the final. India will aim to clinch their maiden women's World Cup title.

Don't know what happened to it: Greg Chappell's Baggy Green goes missingAustralian legend Greg Chappell has revealed that his cherished Baggy Green cap has gone missing after being in storage for about ten years. The former captain discovered the loss upon moving to Adelaide recently, though he stopped short of suggesting it had been stolen.

MS Dhoni arrives in India from US vacation amid wait for IPL retention rulesMS Dhoni landed in India amid the building anticipation over his retention in CSK franchise for IPL 2025. The BCCI and IPL governing council are expected to announce the retention rules soon.

OTD in 2010: CSK became 1st team to win both titles of IPL and CLT20 in a yearOn This Day in 2010, CSK scripted history by becoming the first-ever team to win both IPL and CPL in a single year. They beat Mumbai Indians in IPL 2010 final and Warriors in the summit clash of Champions League T20.

Jitesh could pip Kishan for 2nd wicketkeeper's slot in T20IsIndia vs Bangladesh: Jitesh Sharma could be selected over Ishan Kishan as the second wicketkeeper for the Indian team led by Suryakumar Yadav in the T20I upcoming series. The announcement of the Indian squad is expected later this week.

Watch: Indian team starts training in Kanpur amid fun chats and bantersThe Indian team began intense training at the Green Park Stadium in Kanpur amid fun chats and banter among players. The 2nd Test match between India and Bangladesh will begin on September 27.

Women's T20 World Cup: Deepti takes inspiration from India men's team, eyes titleDeepti Sharma has taken inspiration from the Indian men's team and their recent T20 World Cup triumph. The Indian women's team will eye their maiden women's T20 World  Cup title.

OTD in 2010: CSK became 1st team to win both titles of IPL and CLT20 in a yearOn This Day in 2010, CSK scripted history by becoming the first-ever team to win both IPL and CPL in a single year. They beat Mumbai Indians in IPL 2010 final and Warriors in the summit clash of Champions League T20.

New National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru almost ready: Dilip VengsarkarDilip Vengsarkar, former India captain and BCCI Apex Council member, expressed his satisfaction with the 'almost ready' National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru. The NCA, featuring modern facilities, will be inaugurated later this week.

Barcelona still a work in progress despite great start in LaLiga: Hansi Flick FC Barcelona have started the La Liga season with seven consecutive victories, but manager Hansi Flick believes there's still room for improvement, despite their hard-fought 1-0 win over Getafe on Wednesday.

Going to take another 10 years to produce a Grand Slam champion: Leander PaesTennis legend Leander Paes believes India needs a decade and a grassroots transformation to produce a Grand Slam champion. Speaking at the Tennis Premier League auction, he stressed the importance of nurturing young talent and tapping into rural areas.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
